comment: Two things. One, if you don't like to read, avoid like the plague. It's not a hard class, but what he lectures on or refers to will make no sense unless you read his textbooks. Two, he won't tell you what to study. So if you are used to a study guide or something this is not the class. Just read what he tells you and come to class. You'll be okay.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational

comment: Marks is a nice guy and tries to teach but he's just very unorganized! During class he would ramble and play random videos to try to piece together a lecture but, I still never really learned anything. The class felt like a waste of time and he also made borderline racist comments which made me uncomfortable. He tries, but I wouldn't take him again
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring

comment: Read Read! Prof Marks seems to enjoy teaching. If you can follow directions it's an easy A. If you don't understand directions ask & he will explain even if it means he circles back 17 times to make sure you read the directions. He will make you think you missed something when in reality his directions may not have been clear to anyone but him.

TWO THINGS : APA on papers! If you make one mistake then he dings you for it. Went to Writing Center and still got points off for my APA citations. Follow his examples. DO NOT COPY AND PASTE The Citation from another source retype it. READ the text. He's the APA police. Tests are not hard if you have read the book.

Alright, so basically this guy is super nice. Almost too nice because kids would walk all over him and were pretty disrespectful. His lectures are long and he doesn't really cover direct text. He likes to teach through telling stories which isn't my style so I had to work a lot harder to pass by reading the book. Papers are super easy.
Great Prof if you pay attention and read book.

Lectures are interesting. No power points or note taking necessary. Read the book, even if it's not great (Pearson). It is necessary to getting good grades on tests. Weekly online quizzes can be taken ad nauseam. So read the book, don't skip class, arrive late, or leave early, remember to take the quizzes, and you should pass.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Dr. Marks was the most intriguing, yet laid back professor I have ever had. As long as you show up and do the four papers that he assigns, you have basically got an A. Tests all online except final.

Dr. Marks is an amazing guy, but not so much a good teacher. We had 5 tests (one for each section of the book, and they are all online except for the final). He posts practice quizzes on D2L that have some of the same exact questions that appear on the tests. As well, there are 5 thought papers that are easy A's if you just follow the format.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--GRADED BY FEW THINGS--Caring

comment: He is a funny guy that lectures only personal stories so you have to teach yourself with the book. There were 5 test and all online except final so it's doing I got an A. But at end of semester said the next year was doing test only and either pass or fail so.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY--Amazing lectures

comment: Pretty decent professor, pretty clear guidelines. Just test and paper based, Thought Papers were pretty easy, just hard to figure out his format he wants. Cool guy in class, just read the book if you want to do well. Test are only based on book. Just talks about life story's and tries to relate it to real world stuff. Id take him again.
I loved this professor! His lectures are mostly just his experiences and personal stories. The test are taken straight from the book so if you read you should get an A on every test.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: I loved this professor. His lectures are mostly just his experiences and personal stories. The test are taken straight from the book so if you read you should get an A on every test.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: I love Dr. Marks! Although I stopped going to class because I wasn't really into it I just needed the class. But he is really funny and lecture heavy. There are 5 test and 5  paper, which sounds hard but it's not. The papers are thought papers so he doesnt care what you write as long as the format is correct. All the test are online.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: Dr. Marks may be a bit scattered at times but this class is easy if you do the quizzes he posts online. Taking the quizzes basically ensures an easy A as it appears many of the test questions are from the quizzes -no credit is given for quiz but it gives hints making it an easy study guide.

I regret taking his class. He does not respond to emails, his grading is bizarre, and his lectures are pointless. He takes up the whole class period discussing personal experiences - none of which are on the test. Be prepared to read very thoroughly before each test. His class is unnecessarily complex, and requires a decent time commitment.
Be prepared for lots of interesting stories. There are papers due once every other week or so. Homework is not given on the regular, however if you do not read the book you WILL fail the exams.

Marks is the best professor i have ever had! if you get offended easily dont take him but this man is hilarious. he gives his lectures through life experiences which is super helpful. not a hard class but every test you take will be questions directly from the book so make sure you purchase one. highly recommend taking him if you can or need credit

I couldn't be more confused about lectures. He doesn't discuss ANYTHING you are tested on.  Great guy, super interesting, but his elected way of teaching with no slides or notes or any structure whatsoever is extremely unclear and ineffective.  Be prepared to read, re-read, and then re-re-read if you want A's on tests

I'm thinking this class was about to be a breeze, easy 100. This many puts the most useless of questions on his tests and makes them hard for no reason. His grading is absolutely bizarre. Super nice guy, funny, but just don't know how this man is professor to be completely honest. Dont take him, u will sit in class and ask why you ever signed up..
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Prof Marks is an interesting prof. He is a stickler for APA so make sure you read and follow his directions to the letter or you will not like him. He gives you a chance to correct your mistakes - doesn't tell you what you did wrong, only to make sure you followed directions. Wish he was teaching something else.

Dr. Marks is absolutely one of the best professor's I've taken at KSU.  If you are not a criminal justice major, and need this class to graduate, take him.   I am about to graduate, but I would have been better prepared for college had I taken him my first semester.  This class is fail-proof

Marks may be a bit unconventional and scattered at times, but all you have to do is ask and he is willing to help a student out. He says he won't give study guides on test but if you have read the text you will do fine. Make sure you follow directions and have perfected your APA style or you will find it difficult. No room for deviation.

Dr. Marks is very unprofessional. He does not work with you for any reason- not even family deaths. He is by far the worst professor I have had at KSU and inspired me to change my major from Criminal Justice to something else for the fear of having to run into him in this course again. DO NOT TAKE HIM!!!!
1st CRJU class I've taken. While he did not always post grades in a timely manner, it was an easy class. I enjoyed the material and am now looking at being a CRJU major.

Honestly, you couldn't pay me to take another class with him again. Never replies to emails/questions, if he does then you get a nice one word response that is useless. Grading requirements are confusing and he doesn't post grades in a timely manner. I would've enjoyed this class but this professor unfortunately ruined it for me.

Fairly easy class. Weekly disc posts are 250 words in APA style. Book is needed in order to complete the posts. 2 Cybercrime projects (papers). I received high B's on both. Midterm and Final exam are both typed papers. FOLLOW THE SYLLABUS SCHEDULE and do not miss deadlines because there aren't many make-ups.

Marks is tough but fair. I've had him both F2F and online. If you read you will do fine if you don't read I don't believe you will pass the class. Granted he may not be the best at getting grades posted but if you've done your reading it won't matter if he's timely or not.

Some of these past comments are true, however some are not. Yes, his tests and "projects" are difficult, but if you put the time into doing them then you will get an A. Discussions/responses once a week, tests are all essay but just use your book and you will do fine. He does take a long time to put up grades though. Follow to syllabus for dates.

The course material is not hard at all. My only complaint is that he does not grade in a timely fashion even when the syllabus says it will be within a week. Well, one more complaint is that the links in the assignments do not work.
Definitely would not take a course with him again. He does not answer emails and does not grade anything in a timely manner. Avoid
He hardly ever responds to emails, he is half rude when he does respond and hardly any of the links for the weekly assignments work. Avoid

The class itelf was not overly difficult, however, I would take a course with Mr. Marks again. He takes FOREVER to grade anything, he rarely responds to your emails and he does not keep the course content current at all. Look for another professor

Professor Marks class was horrible, class was only writing. Discussion boards twice weekly, 2 essays that he calls projects, a midterm and final that hard as hell for no reason. Its an online class, he went missing for 2 weeks. I  would not take him again for any reason.

I'm in Prof marks online CRJU 4305 and this class is very simple. I almost did not take him because of earlier comments but I'm glad I did so far thisw class is great. Marks has been responsive to emails.

Easy A course. It consists of weekly quizzes and discussions, 4 exams, and court room observation paper. The teacher is very unprofessional. Email is the key form of communication in an online class. He would not respond to emails in a timely manor and we did not receive any grades until the end of semester, contrary to his syllabus.
Not very focused when lecturing.  Always off track, and unclear.

While this class was super easy this professor is HORRIBLE.  I taught myself the material as he was basically nonexistent the entire semester.  He never graded assignments until the last 2 weeks of the semester.  Avoid if possible. He is very unprofessional and disrespectful to students in his email communication.

I love the info from class. I did have a problem getting the professor to respond to any of my emails.  He never responded. Although his syllabus guarantees grading within a week, it is untrue.The class is still waiting on grades from Jan and Feb and it is now April. He also humiliated a classmate in an email sent to the whole class. Avoid.

Do not take his online class! He never post anything you basically get all your assignments on the syllabus and have to keep up with everything. Test not multiple choice! The way he sets up D2L doesn't let you know when anything is due so its easy to miss a date. Requires a court room observation paper where you actually have to go and observe.
Marks is very accommodating if you make an effort in his class. If you choose not to read you will not do well.

As long as you READ and do the work, this class is not hard. He asks you to outline the chapters, which is optional, but if you do them you can use them on the test. Students who are too lazy to read/write should not take this class. He is sometimes unclear but if you just go up to him after class he tries really hard to help you out.

This is not your regular criminal justice class.  If you do not read the book, you are not going to pass.  Its not bad once you figure out what he wants, which is to tell him what you think - not what the book says.  Overall, it is a lot of work.  A lot of reading and writing.  If you do not like to write, avoid like the plague.
EXACTLY!!  Please stay away from Professor Marks class if you do not like to read or write, else you are going to fail this class. Pure and simple, he is not for you.

Marks is one of the coolest, if not the coolest professors I've ever had. Really laid back, but very serious when it comes to Research Methods. If you don't want to read and write don't bother with this class. It's hard, but still an easy A or B class. Just talk in class and engage and you'll be golden.

I have never dropped a professor after the first class and Marks was my first. He was extremely disrespectful to students trying to be big and bad, cussing and seemingly uneducated. Pop quizzes are up to a coin flip, 15 PAGE PAPER w/ no internet sources, ridiculous amount of work and readings. AVOID AT ALL COSTS!!!

This is the second semester I have taken Professor Marks, and I love the way he teaches.  He is the first professor I have had in college that does not tell me how to think.   I can say anything, but he does not hold doing so against me.  The only negative thing I can say is he spends too much time with indolent students who refuse to read.

This class is ridiculous hard.  Marks will not tell you what questions will be on his test; he says read and comprehend the book.  He checks and makes sure the entire class read the assignment every day. Whether or not a quiz is given depends on the flip of a quarter (read everything he tells you because it always lands on heads).
Avoid like the Plague.

That's not true.  If you are going to say bad things about him, tell the whole truth.  That test was written in APA format, and it was word-for-word from the book. However, you forgot to mention that he gave us a word bank with all the correct answers.  It's the test we asked for, and its the exact test we were given.  Jeesh.

The professor tries really hard to accomindate each student. He expects his students to think and participate in class discussions. He is strict on APA style but is willing to help if asked. We watched many videos and listened to guest speakers on terrorism. Just do your best and don't be late to class-- you'll do just fine.

No kiding about the APA.  You have to read the book in this class, and write a paper.  It was six pages, but he showed us how to do a literature review, look up absracts, search with key words, and allowed us to correct our paper if we turned it in on time. I had to work a lot in this class, but it was worth it.

You better know APA and be able to memorize the book verbatim. Clearly anyone that is a robot will have no problems with this class. Although he says not to worry about the grades, he still grades harshly. MARGINS, MARGINS, MARGINS. He's a good guy though and is still finding himself professorily.

Confusing at first, but by the end of the semester you will appreciate this class. Tests are very hard, perhaps the hardest I've taken at KSU, but he lets you use the book. I had to take this class again, and if I had taken him the first time I would have been better off.

Good guy and tries to make class interesting. If you forget to read the book youre screwed. I felt like most of the time we were repeating the same material or argueing but thats mostly because of a few select people in the class.
He gives take home test.

Awesome guy.  Tries very hard to make class interesting and different than most boring lecture professors.  This is a terrorism class and we watched a lot of videos and had guest speakers.  A little unclear with directions but makes up for it and curved everyones grade.
He has a pop quiz every monday
